text: Donald III (c. 1032–1099), was King of Scots from 1093–1094 and 1094–1097. He was also called Donald the Fair and Donald the White. His father was Duncan I of Scotland.Oram, Richard, The Canmores: Kings & Queens of the Scots 1040–1290. Tempus, Stroud, 2002. In May 1094, Donald's nephew Duncan II stole the throne. Duncan was killed and Donald became king again in November 1094.John of Fordun, Chronicle of the Scottish Nation, ed. William Forbes Skene, tr. Felix J.H. Skene, 2 vols. Reprinted, Llanerch Press, Lampeter, 1993. ISBN 1-897853-05-X Donald died in 1099 and his nephew Edgar became king. ==References== Category:Kings and Queens of Scotland Category:1030s births Category:1099 deaths Category:11th century in Scotland
title: Donald III of Scotland
